website_summaries.verdict: Coming with premium features for a three-ton jack stand, this pair is a good choice if you want more substance and build quality compared to budget options.
pros: Stands each come with a convenient, reliable pivoting lever that locks in place to keep the cradle from falling
The axle cradle fits most vehicles to provide a secure hold
Solid base means you can use these stands even off road
cons: The jack stands are heavier than other three-ton options

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality welds
customer_reviews.text: I bought these hoping for better quality then the recalled Harbor Freight stands that nearly killed me THESE ARE NO BETTER Very poor splattery welds, inconsistent stamping and forging, just meh paint finish, so it'll rust quick I don't trust them, I'm sending them back I thought OTC would've been a quality brand, but I guess not They are Made in China (not inherently a problem), they are very poorly made (BIG PROBLEM)
customer_reviews.author: Michael Luscher

customer_reviews.title: Best Jack Stamd - Won’t Damage Asphalt Driveway
customer_reviews.text: Best jack stands ever. No shear pins to pull. A great mechanical joint to hold vehicle up. In place, practically impossible to casually override the locking mechanical joint. Not something characteristic of other brands. BIGGEST BONUS: Flat plate of steel under the legs which eliminates the jack stand from cutting into an asphalt driveway.
customer_reviews.author: GearHead

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality control
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two sets (four total jack stands) and one of them had a ton of casting issues on the pawl that wedges into the bar. It seemed like it could be genuinely unsafe, but it's only on one out of the four jack stands I got. I'll be returning that set, but keeping the good ones.
customer_reviews.author: Tanner Wilson

customer_reviews.title: 10 stars
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was expecting from OTC another great made addition to my tools for my garage
customer_reviews.author: DOC

customer_reviews.title: I've used these extensively to keep my car up for ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used these extensively to keep my car up for long periods of time. They're really strong and stable. Compared to the cheaper amateur versions, it's made of noticeably thicker steel with strong welds. I don't mess around when my life is on the line, and I trust these to do their job.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan OBrien

customer_reviews.title: The feet are important if you don’t have concrete.
customer_reviews.text: I like the cast iron centers. Plenty sturdy for my use.
customer_reviews.author: Bill K

customer_reviews.title: and they felt very sturdy when holding up my vehicle
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for home usage, and they felt very sturdy when holding up my vehicle. On the downside, the 'V' where the frame sits is fairly deep, so it can be a bit of a chore to line things up properly without having the upper points of the 'V' touching something they shouldn't be. Otherwise, no issues with the finish or quality of the pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Office Manager A

customer_reviews.title: Solid stands
customer_reviews.text: Nice, substantial and well made. They make my original 2.5 ton jack stands look like amateurs. They are definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Matt N.

customer_reviews.title: feel safe with these jack stands
customer_reviews.text: nice sturdy jack stands. the size is perfect. its only a fraction bigger than the 2 ton jack stands. barely notice the difference in size and yet its sturdier. the flat feet legs keeps it from sinking in the yard and the feet flats seem to be welded on good. I didn't see it bend yet and I have tested it on uneven dirt/grass surfaces though not recommended :)
customer_reviews.author: the wrench

customer_reviews.title: does the job
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 sets of these for my son for Christmas, and he said they were great quality, and very useful since he maintains his own cars, and has odd jobs on his property. He feels that they are very safe.
customer_reviews.author: Lauter002

customer_reviews.title: I use these to hold up my 1⁄2 ton pickup ...
customer_reviews.text: I use these to hold up my 1⁄2 ton pickup, no problem. Look at the junk they sell at the big three automotive stores, these are clearly better/stronger. These essentially are protecting your life!
customer_reviews.author: Danno

customer_reviews.title: Smaller then it looks
customer_reviews.text: Nice Jack stands and good build quality but there smaller then I thought
customer_reviews.author: Meows3

customer_reviews.title: A quality tool that you are trusting your life to.
customer_reviews.text: For tools that you trust to support your vehicle while you are working under it, you don't want the bargain bin or discount tool store brands.
customer_reviews.author: mrdale14424

customer_reviews.title: Quality product.
customer_reviews.text: Used these to secure 27' toy hauler while i repacked the bearings. Worked perfect. Very secure.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Work like they should
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to see here; work like they should. The foot pads were a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Mags Dad

customer_reviews.title: Great lil jack stands
customer_reviews.text: Stout lil jack stands. I was a lil apprehensive when I first open the box but they stood up to the test. I rested a 8000 lb + ford f-250 on them. Very pleased
customer_reviews.author: COMFORTABLY NUMB

customer_reviews.title: These are great 3 ton stands
customer_reviews.text: These are great 3 ton stands, the fit, finish and price is excellent. I did a lot of shopping and research before buying. I talked with one guy who bought similar stands from Harbor Freight and they collapsed on him, luckily he escaped injury and didn't have to sue.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Nice jack stands
customer_reviews.text: Used them on 2008 Dodge Grand Caravan with 3-ton Pittsburgh jack. Worked great!
customer_reviews.author: sonlds2002

customer_reviews.title: Great Jack Stands
customer_reviews.text: Great, sturdy jack stands with quality welds for a really good price. Sits flat on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: but I have never seen anything this sturdy and this light at this price range
customer_reviews.text: These hold my vehicles up as expected. You can find lighter or cheaper stands, but I have never seen anything this sturdy and this light at this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua T Blanchard

customer_reviews.title: I love them, and glad I bought them
customer_reviews.text: I have used these a handful of times now, and I have zero complaints. I love them, and glad I bought them.
customer_reviews.author: Joe L.

customer_reviews.title: Good stands
customer_reviews.text: These are sturdy stands. I like the fact they have a flat leg so they will not damage the cement floor.
customer_reviews.author: Middle Aged Midwesterner

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Good jack stands - bought two pairs. They are compact but seem strong. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: PeeceeWizard

customer_reviews.title: Jack stands
customer_reviews.text: Used them the day they came. Very sturdy. Easy to use. Good buy
customer_reviews.author: Whitey

customer_reviews.title: Beefy jack stands, heavy duty.
customer_reviews.text: Great jack stands. Not disappointed. Heavy metal seems plenty adequate to support vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: Joy Hardridge

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Feeling
customer_reviews.text: I bought these jack stands because of the feet welded onto the corners. I wanted the increased surface area to help prevent damage to my driveway. Unfortunately, they felt like toys because they weigh almost nothing. I did not trust them to hold 1/2 of my mid-size SUV. Instead, I sent them back and bought the Torin T43004 stands. Yes, they're more expensive. They also have about 20X the surface area, are finished nicely and are extremely strong.
customer_reviews.author: TZ250

customer_reviews.title: over priced
customer_reviews.text: Very poor welds. 1 Jack had runs in paint. Other than that they look good. Over priced in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Roland

customer_reviews.title: As others have stated there are definitely less expensive jack ...
customer_reviews.text: As others have stated there are definitely less expensive jack stands but then again do you trust your life to them?
customer_reviews.author: i1dave2

customer_reviews.title: These are good sturdy stands which replaced 30 year old ones Should ...
customer_reviews.text: These are good sturdy stands which replaced 30 year old ones Should work fine for the average DYI guy with average sized vehicles..
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd E. Anderson

product_meta.title: OTC 5372 Stinger 3-Ton Jack Stands - Pair
product_meta.description: OTC's 3-ton jackstands feature a high strength, high capacity design that provides the kind of peace of mind you can't get from no-name stands when working under heavy vehicles. Rugged formed and welded steel base includes welded foot pads that resist sinking into soft ground or asphalt. For safety, the self-locking ratchet handle cannot be released under load. Support saddles are designed with multiple contours that enable you to securely support vehicles from a multitude of lift points. Centers of contoured support saddles are recessed to accept rocker panel pinch welds, allowing vehicles to be safely supported from manufacturer designated lift/support locations. Stands feature a 7-1/2 inch x 8-1/4 inch footprint, a heavy steel rack bar that offers 11 height settings from 12 inches to 17-11/16 inches, and a durable baked enamel finish that resists rust and corrosion. Stands conform to ANSI/PALD standards and are factory tested before shipment. Value is at the core of the OTC tool and equipment portfolio. For a simple repair or the most complex drivability concern, these award-winning tools universally solve problems faster, and at better value, than any other product line available. Whether it’s a specialty tool or unique piece of service equipment, OTC provides top solutions to modern automotive service challenges while increasing technicians’ productivity and shop profits.
feature_bullets: OTC's 3-ton jackstands feature a high strength, high capacity design that provides the kind of peace of mind you can't get from no-name stands when working under heavy vehicles
Rugged formed and welded steel base includes welded foot pads that resist sinking into soft ground or asphalt; self-locking ratchet handle cannot be released under load
Support saddles are designed with multiple contours that enable you to securely support vehicles from a multitude of lift points; heavy steel rack bar offers 11 height settings for versatility
Centers of contoured support saddles are recessed to accept rocker panel pinch welds, allowing vehicles to be safely supported from manufacturer designated lift/support locations
Stands feature a 7-1/2 inch x 8-1/4 inch footprint, 12 inch to 17-11/16 inch height range, and a durable baked enamel finish that resists rust and corrosion; conforms to ANSI/PALD standards
